text:
<copy todir="my_dir" failonerror="true" flatten="true">
 <resources>
   <url url="http://iAmABadURL/ThatDoesNotExist/ConnectionRefused/myfile.txt" />
 </resources>
</copy>

If you have a copy task that copies from a URL where the server is down or does not exist a java.net.UnknownHostException, or a java.net.ConnectException will be thrown.

Even though these exceptions are thrown and failonerror="true" in the copy task, the build will continue on.

Now lets say the URL is valid and the file doesn't exist on the server.  A filenot found exception will be thrown and the build will fail as it should.

This looks like a bug to me?
